message: Jeff, I'll be blunt. Your resume leans hard on sales buzzwords. What do you actually do better than the average sales manager?
I execute under pressure and I close. I read customers quickly, adapt my pitch without wasting time, and I keep teams focused on revenue instead of noise.
You've worked remote and in-store across different countries. Don't tell me it was all smooth. What broke, and what did you fix?
Communication gaps and inconsistent follow-up. I standardized reporting, tightened response times, and coached reps one-on-one until results stabilized.
You list leadership and employee development. Give me one concrete example, not philosophy.
At Qualitystore I promoted two underperforming reps into top sellers by simplifying scripts, shadow-selling with them, and tracking daily conversion metrics.
Last thing for now. Why should I trust you with targets that actually hurt if you miss them?
Because I've lived on targets for years. I don't panic, I don't make excuses, and I adjust fast when numbers slip.
